column5:
I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs morally wrong on principle. But in a relationship, it‚Äôs a no go for me.... like makes me feel physically grossed out and totally turned off. I know not everyone feels that way and that‚Äôs totally fine, so I am super upfront early in a relationship about the fact that it‚Äôs not cool with me. I have a very high sex drive, so it would be a major affront to know i was ignored in favor of someone else. Based on how I feel about sex, it would be an instant turn off, just wouldn‚Äôt work for me.

I think a lot of women don‚Äôt care, some of whom don‚Äôt want sex that much so it works out. Some like porn too. A lot of other women don‚Äôt want anything to do with it, but go along with their partners because they feel like they have no choice. It‚Äôs ok to feel however you feel about it, just be open with your partner. Hopefully it will bring you closer together.

Her husband lying about and hiding an addiction for years is HER ‚Äúbaggage‚Äú? A great family?? Nothing a little mindfulness can‚Äôt help her ignore, huh. Talk about invalidating poor op who seems miserable.

I feel like based on what you‚Äôve said here, you should just move on and find some happiness in your life. This was miserable to read, and I feel for you. Your feelings matter; starting over with a young child isn‚Äôt easy... I‚Äôve done it. It‚Äôs scary but it‚Äôs doable and change can be a wonderful thing.  if you are unhappy with him and still feel hurt after all this time, you can and should move forward without him. Your feelings matter, and you deserve happiness. I hope you find it.
Then why don‚Äôt they text me first?
Or at the very least make a new email account

This has been the one thing I‚Äôve consistently imbedded into my routine for years (although I do still struggle to get sleep and I do occasionally drink, no drugs anymore and I can‚Äôt drink much because of kids) and I think it gives me a foundation for starting off on the right foot every single day.  Being physically fit and healthy, practicing self care, it all makes me feel so much better just because it‚Äôs taking my mind off all the negative things in my head and putting a positive focus on my actual physical being. Like I can shift my mental focus of evaluating myself to these positive actions and my abilities. I can tell myself, ok, I might not be capable in this emotional aspect (yet), but I can run fast, I mastered a new yoga pose, I ate a delicious healthy meal, I took care of my skin/hair/nails, took all my meds and vitamins. It helps me to feel better about myself, serves as a distraction, and provides me with a positive physical foundation to build upon and try matching my mind to that. It‚Äôs also always there, so if I fall off on anything, I can start right back up again. I am by no means perfect or cured but I highly recommend embracing PLEASE.
Impulsivity, sensation seeking, novelty seeking, at least for me.
Don‚Äôt tell trump, he might actually decide to *do* something about coronavirus
That‚Äôs why there are two bouquets

Very sweet of you to have a plan and be prepared. I see lots of suggestions on here that I think are very good and practical (trash can with a lid, extra pants/undies in case, ask her mom which brand of products), but just so you know she might not necessarily need much more. I never really had cramps and always had light, short periods. I don‚Äôt remember even considering taking medication or using anything for pain because it didn‚Äôt hurt. I also don‚Äôt remember having any other related symptoms like pms, and I danced competitively and played tennis without it ever slowing me down. Just know there‚Äôs a wide range of normal and although you should certainly be sensitive to her cues (and whatever she/her mom tells you) she might actually feel perfectly fine and wants you to treat her normally and that‚Äôs cool too. Be prepared but don‚Äôt automatically assume she will be one way or the other. And be open to communicating, listening, and adapting to her needs.

Ok so I hear you and used to feel that way... lots and lots of messy experiences ensued. But just my experience, what helped me turn a corner: I was in an intensive outpatient program and my psychiatrist kept telling me I needed to stop dating. I couldn‚Äôt. Eventually she was like ok well then you need to find someone who is completely stable, happy and normal. (And only one person at a time...) I was like huh those people exist?? And how I would I relate to them!? But I was afraid I was going to get kicked out of the program for some of my behavior so I was like ok I‚Äôll try it. lo and behold I found my husband who I‚Äôve now been with for almost 6 years! I refused to pretend or hide who I was or what my issues were. I was 1000% upfront with him from the get go. Like oh that alarm on my phone well it‚Äôs time to take my psychiatric medication, those scars are from self harm, etc. I never hid my crazy from him. And because he *wasnt* crazy, he never played into my bullshit or got sucked into the drama I attempted to create. He was patient and supportive, but with no savior complex. He held me to a higher standard, but also didn‚Äôt guilt me if I failed. To this day he helps me and manages my behavior with patience and a sense of humor. And given that for me I tend to reflect and rely heavily on my FP for my own self image and stability, it works out much better when my FP is emotionally and mentally rock solid and generally very positive. I‚Äôm not perfect, or completely ‚Äúcured‚Äù if that‚Äôs even possible, but I‚Äôm truly happy and mentally better than ever with my normie husband.

That‚Äôs probably because this sub features people at very different paths on their journey to build healthier habits. It‚Äôs not called bpd recovery, it‚Äôs just bpd in general, and members‚Äô struggles are being posted in real time. And many of our struggles surround this FP idea. If this isn‚Äôt the place to be honest about that and get it out there for feedback from others who might feel the same, then where is? People who have valuable insight (like you, maybe) can hopefully comment on those posts and help others to see understand those layers to the FP phenomenon in their lives.

Plus, the fact that people talk about it as if it can‚Äôt be changed is pretty much just par for the course with bpd, at least for me anyway, however I feel in a given moment, it often seems like that feeling will go on forever. That doesn‚Äôt mean it actually does, just that people are posting what they feel at an apex of emotion/tension where they simply aren‚Äôt capable of realistic perspective.
The time has come. The time is now. Donald J. Trump will you please go *now.*
So weird I literally don‚Äôt understand what that would be like!? I think I would fall. Like both physically fall over and fall out of my own brain.

This doesn‚Äôt always solve the problem of night wakings though. The baby will still wake up, at least that‚Äôs what mine has done when I‚Äôve tried it every couple months. and in turn wake up mom and dad. It might keep in laws off her back but it sounds like her hope is to get some sleep herself.

I am a married woman, and I feel very upset on your behalf. Her reaction and her behavior seem heartless and shallow. This is not how a marriage should be starting off, and I feel particularly bad about the role her parents seem to be playing in this. I have two sons, and frankly, if either of them went through something like this, I would be having a serious heart to heart about how unfortunately, she might not really be the one. If it were my daughter acting like your fianc√©e, I would tell her to get a grip. 

Whether or not minor feelings of disappointment might be valid and justified on some level, she should also be able to appreciate your feelings ‚Äîand what I think many, many women would agree was a sweet, heartfelt proposal. This is about the decision to get *married* for goodness sakes, not a promposal or a performance. Your decision to ask her in that moment came from love, and if she can‚Äôt find it in herself to understand and appreciate that after 6 weeks of being nasty to you well then you two are just not right for each other. I‚Äôm so sorry.

I think it‚Äôs a red flag that she sees the decision to MARRY someone as if it‚Äôs more important to be Instagram-worthy than heartfelt. And even if she had initial disappointment I don‚Äôt see how it wouldn‚Äôt dawn on her to be appreciative that she has someone there to love her even when she‚Äôs not feeling great and looking perfect because that‚Äôs what marriage is really about. 6 weeks of ‚Äúaggressive‚Äù negative feelings about it towards her fianc√©? That‚Äôs a massive red flag.
Married 5 years and I agree completely.

Not fucked up at all. It‚Äôs the best. For me it‚Äôs brought me more calm and stability than anything else. I‚Äôve been married for almost 6 years and I‚Äôve been much more stable than before. It‚Äôs not a cure, I don‚Äôt know that there even is one, but rather like a strong backbone to keep me standing upright.

I hope you find it.
Right. I don‚Äôt see any mention of how YOU feel about her. She‚Äôs probably just as confused about your side of things and that‚Äôs why she‚Äôs keeping her distance.
I think this is the best step to take. It would also demonstrate to him how serious your concern is for the safety of your baby.

Very good idea. I have done something similar for a family member and I feel like it was very positive, a step in the right direction. Find a way to make it possible for your husband to not have to see his abuser ‚Äî this doesn‚Äôt mean all out confrontation which could be more painful, but just a life where he doesn‚Äôt have to subject himself to the torment of pretending in front of this monster.
Let‚Äôs do it then come on dems

Unclear as to how his actions aren‚Äôt completely embodied by the phrase ‚Äúdecide not to be a father‚Äù.... 

Also we don‚Äôt know anything about their relationship so to say he abandoned her is a little over the top. 

The comparison was to demonstrate that people can change as can their opinion of whether or not they are ready for parenthood

ETA: I‚Äôve had 2 unplanned pregnancies myself. I kept them both, and while their fathers did decide to parent, one far less enthusiastically than the other, that was their decision, not mine. Men shouldn‚Äôt be on the hook for child support, birth support, or as you said buying clothes, food, necessities, etc., just because they had sex ‚Äî unless they choose to parent that child. Just like women shouldn‚Äôt be forced to keep or abort a pregnancy or a baby just because the father (or anyone else) wants them to. Both parties should get a choice. I wouldn‚Äôt want someone else to force my reproductive/parenting choices and thus I respect the autonomy of men to make those choices themselves too.

I know this isn‚Äôt the point but there‚Äôs no such thing as ‚Äúpersonally pro life.‚Äù You‚Äôre pro choice. You don‚Äôt believe the government should have a say in the decisions made between a woman and her physician. That‚Äôs the definition of pro choice. 

I want to underline this point because the idea that pro-choicers are cool and casual about abortion and would do it with no qualms needs to go the fuck away. You *are* pro-choice. You can still be pro choice and personally bothered by the fact that your husband wanted this teenager to get an abortion ‚Äî because it should always be and ultimately was *her* choice what to do with her own body. 

For the record I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything wrong with him choosing to not be involved with his child from 20 years ago and later deciding to become a parent with you. He just didn‚Äôt want to be a father then/with her. Just like how women can give a baby up for adoption when they weren‚Äôt ready and eventually decide to become mothers down the line. I do think it‚Äôs completely messed up that he lied to you this entire time. What else could he be keeping secret??? That part would have me extremely worried.

Wow dad. Way to give your daughter a complex that will likely haunt her for the rest of her life!! Jesus fucking Christ... like women don‚Äôt struggle enough with their sexuality. Good for her for finding a way to explore that part of her safely. For the sake of her sanity and her soul please tell her you disagree with your husband and tell her she should not feel one teensy bit ashamed of what she was doing.

Great idea!!! And then maybe others can post examples in the comments about how they‚Äôve actually used the skills in real life? I‚Äôve done DBT halfway a few times now and even though I learned many of the skills so to speak I still find it hard to actually incorporate them. Obviously it‚Äôs a conscious choice to do so, but I think it would be helpful to see others real life examples.

Your proof is that your wife admitted it and it‚Äôs actively hurting your marriage! Why would she fake that? PLEASE TELL HER. My mind boggles to think of how different my life would have been if someone had told me before I had to find out the hard way... anyway, she deserves to know and you are morally obligated to tell her.
Totally. The only thing I‚Äôm missing is my mom since were all isolating from each other and I‚Äôm unhealthily attached to her. Otherwise it‚Äôs really not that different.
Bears. Beets. Battlestar Galactica.

I‚Äôm not surprised those outlets picked it up but she didn‚Äôt seek them out. She went to a liberal journalist just like Christine blasey ford. She tried to get the women‚Äôs workplace harassment organization *times up* to help her and while they didn‚Äôt fund her case they did support her in trying to secure legal help.

What do you mean when you say she went straight to the right wing noise machine? I‚Äôm trying to wrap my head around the story, and I feel obligated to believe her although I don‚Äôt want to. I thought she was interviewed by a journalist named Katie Halper who works for various liberal media outlets and the intercept also was an early reporter of the story just like they were with Christine blasey ford.
Boycott amazon
The fog is heavy any time I‚Äôm under stress. Cue a pandemic outbreak in my town... I‚Äôm hardly able to string words together lately!
It‚Äôs a very small stamp usually numbers on the clasp.

This is over. If he was a good person you could trust, if he cared about you and the integrity of your relationships, you would have heard this from him with lots of apologies right after it happened. Not only has he cheated on you, he let you believe a lie every day since. 

Please keep in mind, this was probably not a one time thing. Maybe only once with this girl but there were probably others. If he can lie to you and hide it so easily, he has probably done it before. Speaking from direct experience. When you confront him make sure you don‚Äôt give on that you know who jt was with, just tell him firmly that you know he was unfaithful and he needs to confess. Then once you‚Äôve heard enough, leave him and thank your lucky stars you didn‚Äôt marry him. 

So sorry and wishing you the very best.
The night is dark and full of errors

When you confront him, don‚Äôt give any details or say anything that would indicate it was her. Just say something along the lines of I know you‚Äôve been unfaithful. You just asked me to MARRY you. I deserve the truth and you need to give me the full truth right now.

The thing is since he isn‚Äôt the one who decided to come clean, and he‚Äôs just carrying on with no intention to tell you, this likely wasn‚Äôt a one time thing. Maybe once with this girl but it could have happened other times with other one night stands. Confront him vaguely but firmly and make him confess and maybe you will find out more. I‚Äôm speaking from experience. 

I know this is such a difficult time. I‚Äôm so sorry for what you‚Äôre going through. Consider it a blessing that you are finding this out now instead of having a marriage or kids to worry about. And absolutely leave. Do not marry someone who has shown you he will cheat so carelessly and not even have the decency to tell you the truth. Every day since this happened (and likely other times) he has lived a lie. Get the truth. Say your piece. Then save yourself a lifetime of heartbreak and DTMFA.
At many jobs, you can‚Äôt get sick pay without a confirmation that it‚Äôs actually covid-19.

My parents divorced for a couple years when I was in elementary school and then remarried. I wouldn‚Äôt say they have the healthiest marriage but it‚Äôs much better than it was and now they‚Äôve been together ever since. I really don‚Äôt think anything could tear them apart. 

On the other hand they have one set of married friends who have gotten divorced and remarried 3 times and they still to this day in their 50s go back and forth and just don‚Äôt have a stable relationship.
What a beautiful color!

Dude, the first rule of having borderline personality is DONT TALK ABOUT HAVING BORDERLINE PERSONALITY

Rookie mistake, based on my 13 years living with this diagnosis. Sucks but that‚Äôs the rule.
Cool thanks.

It will get better!!! I have been in a similar situation. I didn‚Äôt find out the whole truth until after the baby was born, which included him cheating on me many many times pretty much every opportunity he got over 5 years, but I knew something was up during pregnancy. When everything came out in the open and we filed for divorce, he ran off with someone else, I was on my own with my brand new baby and didn‚Äôt hear from him for months. While I was sad for my son to be missing out on having his father around, I had this incredible gift, my very own baby, to help me to realize my own independence and create a new life for myself. I really didn‚Äôt have time or energy or even room in my heart for sadness over someone who was clearly such a piece of shit; and I had more important things to worry about ‚Äî the challenge of becoming a new mom, healing from birth, and raising an infant ‚Äî all of which was new and exciting. This isn‚Äôt just the birth of your baby. It sounds cheesy, but this is YOUR rebirth into the new you who is SO fucking done with his shit. Please enjoy this time with your baby. Bask in the love of this life you‚Äôve created. Don‚Äôt give him room in your head or your heart to ruin this for you; you might feel vulnerable in your position, I definitely did, but you can learn to wear it like armor. 

My advice for the nitty gritty: Don‚Äôt make any plans that include him, wait until you‚Äôre ready once the baby‚Äôs here and you have seen what kind of father he‚Äôs going to be. While you‚Äôre nesting make sure you have a safe, comfortable place set up with family/friends to help you right after birth. You will want help! Focus on YOU. Also‚Äî Consult legal help if you need to after the baby‚Äôs born. Only include your ex in the labor/birth if you wish and you think it will be positive for you, but don‚Äôt make any additional parenting decisions with him until you‚Äôre actually dealing with the baby. My guess is a guy who‚Äôs seeing prostitutes while his wife is pregnant isn‚Äôt going to be the most helpful during the newborn phase. Trust me it‚Äôs his loss. Focus on you and baby and soak up all the adorable baby love!!!
Which laser treatment?

I can‚Äôt comprehend how this isn‚Äôt career-ending already! No other dem candidate could cuss at a voter and get in his face like that. If he really did threaten to slap the guy, he‚Äôs gone way too far. Trump territory. Someone needs to pull him out of the race and put an end to this entire debacle. If this doesn‚Äôt do it, what will?

I‚Äôm so sorry you‚Äôre going through this. I think giving yourself space to clear your head is wise and will help you to heal. I‚Äôm so sorry it doesn‚Äôt seem like she‚Äôs going to be respectful of your wishes. So selfish... sounds like she just doesn‚Äôt want to feel the pain herself. Again I‚Äôm so sorry. You will get through this.

She didn‚Äôt even invite you to her wedding and she expects you to play grandpa to her kids...??? Does not compute. 

You did the right thing. Don‚Äôt trust her. Continue being respectful/cordial for the sake of your wife, but otherwise, avoid her altogether.

Yikes. Can we not remember that these women are also people?? I have always hated when married men have given me that *prolonged glance* especially with a visible wedding ring or even with their wife right there. What about these women he‚Äôs ogling, what do they think and how do they feel? Just so awkward. 

If he feels the need to look, it shouldn‚Äôt be noticeable. Anything more than a casual glance is disrespectful to the wife AND the women.

Are you talking about faking an orgasm or faking your interest in sex at all? How about you ask him to make you orgasm first, that way you will actually enjoy it. I have 3 young children myself so I know it‚Äôs hard to find the time, but if it‚Äôs worth doing, then it‚Äôs worth doing right. Find a way to enjoy it, set aside time or schedule it, and then do or talk about things that turn you on with your husband. I really can‚Äôt comprehend faking any part of it... don‚Äôt do that to yourself or your marriage.
9 weeks!
Be real. How do you think people who are divorced operate? You just only communicate when it comes to what‚Äôs relevant to coparenting the kids. No contact on all other topics.

Parents, brother, uncles, etc., even strangers. The conventional wisdom is if I react when my little boy is hurt, bothered, or upset, he will not learn to tough it out, instead he‚Äôll learn to react from seeing my reaction. I‚Äôve been told I‚Äôm ‚Äúcoddling‚Äù then for this reason. Literally if my kid falls on the playground or their toy breaks I‚Äôm supposed to have almost no reaction so he supposedly decides it‚Äôs no big deal and moves on.

Honestly I think must know you‚Äôre rushing into it way too quickly and this will likely turn out to be nothing but a great rebound for you. Take the time to work through your issues with this guy especially if he gives you comfort and makes you happy, but you‚Äôre likely still in shock and mourning, so the emotions you‚Äôre feeling with him are undoubtedly mixed up with the whole mess of feelings toward your ex. In terms of figuring out how to trust, it will take time, and your might not ever trust blindly again. Be open and honest and recognize how you feel, communicate, and work through it just like you‚Äôre doing. Time and his actions are the only way to earn your trust ‚Äî it‚Äôs likely a never-ending process. Don‚Äôt rush yourself to give trust that hasn‚Äôt been earned.

I 100% let my little boys cry. I can‚Äôt even comprehend the callousness of a mother saying something like this to their child.... My boys are currently 4 and 6 and besides trying to teach them how to get through tantrums, I instinctively care about, validate, and listen to their feelings. I even ‚Äîshockingly! ‚Äî comfort them when they get hurt and cuddle them while they cry, despite the fact that I constantly get advice that I shouldn‚Äôt so they ‚Äútoughen up.‚Äù 

I‚Äôm a very emotional person and I raised my oldest on my own as a single mother for the first year and a half, so I really just followed my gut which led me to care about how they felt. I get very defensive of my little guys when people feel the need to say anything negative about them expressing their emotions. I‚Äôve also seen some other little boys their age who already seem like robots. In the nature vs nurture debate, I believe that through nurturing I can teach my sons how to feel and process their emotions with depth and maturity.
Tell that to my 14 month old who‚Äôs never taken a bottle and doesn‚Äôt sleep through the night

Maybe I‚Äôm oversimplifying this but I see zero reason why you would even think about having sex with him. You literally don‚Äôt want to be married to him and if it weren‚Äôt for finances and paperwork you‚Äôd be divorced ‚Äî and you don‚Äôt even sound like you have enjoyed sex or want to have sex with him. Don‚Äôt do it unless/until you actually want to do it.

Have you not seen cosmo?? Or any women‚Äôs magazines? Maybe it was just because of who was participating in this particular thread you read, but I personally feel like women are inundated by messages that we aren‚Äôt doing enough or could be doing more to please men in bed.
I have 3 kids. A parole officer doesnt teach criminals to use deodorant, a mom does. I‚Äôm being sympathetic to the poor kid!

A parole officer?? WTF does that have to do with anything. He‚Äôs in elementary school for goodness sakes. Just be a parent and teach him how to do these things. He‚Äôll get it eventually, but I wouldn‚Äôt expect it to be for a couple years.

You dodged a bullet. Thank goodness you trusted your instincts and demanded an answer from her. You could have ruined your whole life by marrying her! Now instead, you‚Äôre still young at 28, learned some lessons and gained some experiences, and you get to move on and start fresh. Many of us have experienced that same pain but add in marriage and children to the mix. NOT FUN. Very best of luck to you and congrats on having the self respect to ditch her and move forward.
GIRL. Put him in the bin!!!

I don‚Äôt know if people say this anymore but YOU GO GIRL! Seriously I‚Äôm so impressed by your dedication. I‚Äôve literally wanted to do all of these things and only dabbled so far. So what if you‚Äôre not professional level yet, or ever, you‚Äôre doing it. You‚Äôre improving yourself. You‚Äôre developing new skills. And you‚Äôre growing as a person. Keep it up and enjoy the process as well as the outcome.
Pro gamer move
She doesn‚Äôt even know the wife so why would she care about the wife not caring or lashing out. She can just send an anonymous email or fb message tipping her off.

Is there anyone you can go stay with to help you with the new baby? I‚Äôve had 3, and I feel like the number one thing I needed those early days was sleep. You need to rest and recover. If your parents or friends or anyone in your support system can either take you in for a few day or come and stay so you can get a few decent chunks of sleep, I bet you‚Äôll be able to process all of this much better. My biggest concern when reading this is that you have the support and help you need to heal and care for your little one. 

In terms of your husband, I can imagine you are incredibly disappointed with him. All I kept thinking when reading that was that he must be scared or selfish. Maybe he just still  needs some time to adjust, I‚Äôm hoping for your sake he snaps the fuck out of this, but I am horrified by his behavior on your behalf. 

Please take care of yourself! No woman should be without support in this time. I wish you and your boys the very best.
Rondal mcdondal
This is such an important point. We can‚Äôt take for granted that there are plenty of people who don‚Äôt even understand that women and children don‚Äôt have to legally take the husbands last name.

I sympathize with your internal struggle and it seems like you‚Äôre being very thoughtful about it based on your edit, and really it‚Äôs just a shitty situation to be in where rarely is everyone (ie the woman) happy. I say this out of my own frustration with this last name crap personally as well as just for basically all the women I know and read about dealing with this and so many other bullshit, gendered expectations: I‚Äôm sick of men feeling entitled to even our NAMES for fucks sake. Add it to the list along with our bodies, our time, our smiles, etc. 

I don‚Äôt blame my husband for wanting and expecting me to take his name. It‚Äôs so deeply culturally imbedded, I remember talking to some male colleagues who said it would be a *dealbreaker* if their wife wanted to keep her OWN NAME, and plenty of people who thought children and wives are legally required to take the husbands name! WTF. it‚Äôs the sort of thing that signals masculinity in a clear, direct way because it almost never goes the other way that men take the woman‚Äôs name. It‚Äôs super easy for them since it‚Äôs not their sacrifice but also something straight men have always taken for granted‚Äî thinking about their own moms and teachers and all the women they‚Äôve known throughout our cultural history. I feel like all I can do now is try to make sure my sons don‚Äôt grow up feeling so entitled down the line.

It looks like the writings on the wall here, and 99% of the time this means infidelity has occurred. Especially with 2 stds. WOW. and I‚Äôm so sorry you‚Äôre going through this. But just have to check: do you have any symptoms? Is that why you went in to the doctor? I ask because at the beginning of my previous pregnancy I had a positive in-office trichinomiasis test out of nowhere and freaked out when they told me it‚Äôs treatable but only sexually transmitted. My husband was dumbfounded and swore he hadn‚Äôt done anything sexual with anyone else in years‚Äî he wasn‚Äôt even all that defensive, never gaslighted me, just was concerned and confused. I also had NO symptoms whatsoever. She checked it again and said to her it looked positive but her in-office diagnostics aren‚Äôt always 100% so she sent it out to a lab to get tested. NEGATIVE. Not even a trace for the full std panel. Then she explained that sometimes sperm cells get confused with trich cells... odd, and thanks for freaking me out for nothing, but I was just relieved. Idk how that could have happened in your case ‚Äî maybe a lab mixup? ‚Äî but I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs pointless to get retested. This will likely have a very significant impact on your life, so you want to be sure. 

Also, if you confirm std diagnosis (or have obvious symptoms) I highly recommend you wait at least a few days before you confront him to get your wits about you and speak with a lawyer just so you don‚Äôt get blindsided by the grief when you speak to him. I‚Äôm so sorry you‚Äôre going through this, and I wish you the best.

Ok so to you sex would show you that you are wanted and valued over this other guy, but here‚Äôs the thing: you aren‚Äôt. 

Accept that and move on.
The meaning is that all the money in the world can‚Äôt buy you a sense of humor

Wow this was kind of hard to read. Your pain is palpable and I‚Äôm so sorry for what you‚Äôve been through. I went through a somewhat similar situation, the AP was his engaged coworker who he said I would be great friends with, although I was actually pregnant at the time. Almost 7 years out from divorce now, and I can‚Äôt deny that it messed me up a bit; although I don‚Äôt feel pain about the events of what happened, I still doubt myself because I felt so sure and was so very wrong about someone I had spent my entire adult life with. I trust my now husband of five years, but I don‚Äôt trust my own judgment so I question everything and I don‚Äôt think I would ever take ‚Äúforever‚Äù for granted again. However, I feel so sad that you have this sense of longing for *him* and I think maybe you haven‚Äôt fully regained your sense of self yet. Because I had a one month old baby to take care of when AP called off her wedding and my ex ran off with her, I very quickly began my own journey to who I was and I also had my priorities crystal clear. I recommend trying to set up your own goals and think about who you are and who you have been without centering the past decade mentally around your ex. 

Also, my ex is still with his AP, married with a child. Just like you mentioned I too had everyone comforting me with the obvious ‚Äúyou‚Äôre prettier, smarter, and cooler than she is‚Äù but I know that makes it even more confusing. I started to question myself, amplify my flaws... because if I‚Äôm prettier, smarter, and cooler and he still chose her, well then I must have some major negatives that he wasn‚Äôt willing to overlook. Then I started dating ‚Äî which was very new for me since my ex had been my first serious relationship at 19 ‚Äî and I realized immediately that we simply weren‚Äôt right for each other, and that we just didn‚Äôt have as much in common as I thought. Maybe your current boyfriend isn‚Äôt the ‚Äúone‚Äù but your differences with your ex are vast. Just because you had your future kids name picked out (which I had to realize myself isnt an indicator of commitment) doesn‚Äôt mean you actually had the same values, priorities, and lifestyle preferences. Obviously he is VERY different from you in that respect, he just found his right person sooner than you did. Your right person will ultimately be so so so much better for you that you will forget all about the pain and wonder why you ever wasted that energy on someone who was so wrong for you. At least, I know that‚Äôs possible. 

Final thought since you mentioned fantasizing about revenge. I totally get it, but one of the most satisfying things you might realize is that your revenge is already happening without you doing a single thing. YOU will undoubtedly hang over HER head for years. Maybe even the rest of her life. Clearly you and your ex did have fond feelings and happy times. He was so committed to you he led her along for years, even let her marry someone else. He wasn‚Äôt right for you, but he did love you. And she not only knows it, she had to see it, fight against it, wonder how long it would go on for. She will always compare herself to you and recall painfully how long she had to share so much of him with you. You saw just how much disdain she had for you when you met, and although she got to keep him, she will always deal with the memories of you two together that she saw with her own two eyes for a long time. Plus, he‚Äôs clearly no prize and not someone you would want to marry anyway, and the dark cloud of the affair and lies and shadows will always loom over their marriage. They know exactly what each other is capable of and sowed those seeds of doubt before they ever got to build a foundation. I know I couldn‚Äôt live like that, and now you don‚Äôt have to. Free yourself of her and him, free your mind and heart and appreciate the lessons you learned along the way. Living well is the best revenge. Never look back.

Please don‚Äôt bury your head in the sand about this. He will just keep doing it so long as he can get away with it. It sounds like he knows you aren‚Äôt going anywhere, even if you wanted to. Make an effort to get a job; your daughter will be starting school soon anyway. Maybe look into work-from-home customer service or sales jobs. This will allow you to gain some confidence in yourself and some independence as well as maybe make him realize he can‚Äôt continue to take you for granted. Also I highly recommend you take some time away from him just temporarily. If there are any family members you can stay with for just even a few nights (don‚Äôt tell him how long you‚Äôll be gone) it would be helpful, and tell him you need some space and don‚Äôt talk to him during that time. This will allow you some space to think clearly and him some time to realize what he‚Äôs fucking up. There‚Äôs also the option of making him leave for a while ‚Äî I know you share the house idk how that would go over but the point is you need to put some distance between him and you to gain some self worth.

Have you heard of 50 shades of grey? I feel like all that rough sex stuff actually got super popular a few years ago, even middle-aged vanilla soccer moms were going crazy over it. Probably different for you because obviously it‚Äôs more deep seated, but it doesn‚Äôt mean you are fucked up, you are just kinky. Your husband and you are likely just mismatched. 

The cheating thing you definitely need to get under control though. This is a problem; having sexual kinks isn‚Äôt one.

I‚Äôm also 31, hyper sexual, and definitely have had some of those same interests... why do you feel like you need to deny yourself though? I don‚Äôt think thinking about sex or having high libido if something you should feel guilty about. Plus having fantasies and wanting roughness is actually not all that uncommon. Doesn‚Äôt mean that it‚Äôs not trauma related if that‚Äôs an issue for you, but lots of people like rough sex who have no traumatic pasts. Regardless it‚Äôs ok to want what you want. That doesn‚Äôt have to mean you are bad/dark/damaged. 

I was diagnosed over a decade ago, so maybe I‚Äôm just further along in the process of accepting some of these things about myself, but I don‚Äôt think anyone should be shamed for their high (or low) sex drive or their sexual preferences/fantasies so long as they are respectful of others and not making unreasonable demands of their partner. It sounds like you are being so hard on yourself! It might help to explore the issue of shame re: sex with your therapist. I wish you the best.
